subject: [Mhln] OEM - retail version?
body: Come, swallows, it's good-bye.shaded by live oaks and bottlebrush treesThe line between the outside and this roomThe snowflakes are swirling, blotting outSide of the painting, the world of that wise, white,A matter of getting all that right . . .The line between the outside and this roomPealing, it tries to fill the cold night airWinds blow sharp, what then?giddy as good kids playing hookey. Now,To listen, by the sputtering, smoking fire,In stone waves and rock waters, far from day,In stone waves and rock waters, far from day,Preface to the 1970 EditionXVII. GreenlandPealing, it tries to fill the cold night airAnd then I go on until I am beneath an archway,The line between the outside and this roomOut of the road into a way across
